bioghist.p: The Huron River Watershed Intergovernmental Committee, comprised of various cities and townships in Southeastern Michigan, was established in 1958 to "sponsor studies of water problems" in the area (HRWIC, first annual report, p.2). In 1965, the Huron River Watershed Intergovernmental Committee became the Huron River Watershed Council.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of various publications of the Huron River Watershed Intergovernmental Committee, mainly Watershed news publications as well as annual reports. Publications from 1965 and later are in the Huron River Watershed Council publication collection.
